result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Domonique Pittman

records.addlTxt: all prior conditions as ordered remain the same.

Defendant Angelo Domonique Pittman in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Angelo Domonique Pittman.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken for Amy Spanczak in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Justice Point Violation. State's Motion on Bail heard and argued.  The Court ORDERS cash bail in amount of $50.00, with turnover to Justice Point under Level 5 Supervision. All other conditions previously ordered remain in effect. Court further ORDERS defendant to cooperate with Justice Point regarding treatment. Defendant remanded into custody.

Case remains set for Plea hearing on 12/14/2022 at 1:30 pm in Br. 9.
Pretrial Services Violation Report - 10-27-2022, filed.

Defendant Angelo Domonique Pittman in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Angelo Domonique Pittman.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference.  Discussion held regarding Justice Point appointments.  Court ORDERS the defendant to go directly to Justice Point and return to the courtroom.  Case passed.

Case recalled at 11:03 am. 
Attorney Graber and Mr. Pittman appear, Attorney Jon Josephsen appears on behalf of Attorney Spanczak.  Alyssa Kubly, Justice Point Case Manager, appears in Court. Justice Point has filed a violation report with positive drug results.  The court ORDERS the Defendant to cooperate with Justice Point regarding assistance with assessment for drug treatment. Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  All plea documents shall be filed at least 3 days prior to the next hearing date. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-7-2022, filed.
The Court INCREASES Justice Point SUPERVISION to Level 5.  Court ORDERS absolute sobriety and random urine screens. All other conditions previously ordered remain the same.

Defendant Angelo Domonique Pittman in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Angelo Domonique Pittman.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Further Proceedings. Defendant appears in person. Court withdraws issued bench warrant. State requests modification of Justice Point supervision.  The Court INCREASES Justice Point SUPERVISION to Level 5 and ORDERS absolute sobriety and random urine screens.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelo Domonique Pittman not in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Angelo Domonique Pittman.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Calendar Call.  Court previously issued and stayed a Bench Warrant.  State requests a bench warrant be issued for non appearance. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-26-2022, filed.

Attorney Katherine Graber appears via video.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defendant does not appear although counsel advised that Defendant was made aware of today's hearing.   Defendant has been compliant with Justice Point supervision. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court sets next court date for a Calendar Call in Br. 9.  Defendant ordered to appear in person for next hearing date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pretrial Services Amended Supervision Report 8-9-2022, filed

Defendant Angelo Domonique Pittman in court by video with Attorney Katherine Graber who appears in person.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver.  Received and Filed.  nk
received and filed

Defendant Angelo Domonique Pittman in court, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-9-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Angelo Domonique Pittman in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Angelo Domonique Pittman in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angelo Domonique Pittman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor countS 2 and 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
